name: volume-weighted-stats
author: Washington University School of Medicin
description:
WEIGHTED SPATIAL STATISTICS ON A VOLUME FILE.

For each subvolume of the input, a line of text is printed, resulting from the specified operation.  If -weight-volume is not specified, each voxel's volume is used.  Use -subvolume to only give output for a single subvolume.  If the -roi option is used without -match-maps, then each line will contain as many numbers as there are maps in the ROI file, separated by tab characters.  Exactly one of -mean, -stdev, -percentile or -sum must be specified.

Using -sum without -weight-volume is equivalent to integrating with respect to volume.

inputs.name: opt_weight_volume_weight_volume
inputs.description: use weights from a volume file: volume file containing the weights

inputs.name: opt_subvolume_subvolume
inputs.description: only display output for one subvolume: the subvolume number or name

inputs.name: opt_roi_roi_volume
inputs.description: only consider data inside an roi: the roi, as a volume file

inputs.name: opt_percentile_percent
inputs.description: compute weighted percentile: the percentile to find, must be between 0 and 100

inputs.name: opt_show_map_name
inputs.description: print map index and name before each output
